sentences.english: Touch a pot of wine, drink it, drunk beautiful voice.
sentences.chinese: 触一壶美酒，饮尽惆怅，醉美心声。

sentences.english: That was the voice of Horne the entertainer.
sentences.chinese: 这就是霍恩作为一个艺人的心声。

sentences.english: Building a bridge between us, listening to our hearts, showing our affections.
sentences.chinese: 驾起心中的彩桥，互相倾听心声，互相交流感情。

sentences.english: The sunshine greets me with a smile. The rain, his sad sister, talks my heart.
sentences.chinese: 阳关微笑着问候我，雨，他忧郁的妹妹向我吐露心声。

sentences.english: It is everyone's common heart-felt wish that let our world be full of love.
sentences.chinese: 让人间充满爱是每个人共同的心声。

sentences.english: The Friend of the fatherless heard.
sentences.chinese: 无父的朋友听到我的心声。

sentences.english: This is Air China cabin crew chief, director of the voice of Kai-Yan.
sentences.chinese: 这是中国国际航空公司客舱部主任乘务长阎开的心声。

sentences.english: Listen to your heart and it will tell you all you need to know.
sentences.chinese: 要倾听你自己的心声，它会告诉你所需要知道的一切。

sentences.english: This gives expression to the national aspirations for reforms.
sentences.chinese: 这反映了全国要求改革的心声。

sentences.english: Disturbed the night to sing to sing the dim light the lower levels become out of my mind sad recollections.
sentences.chinese: 夜唱忐忑唱灯火阑珊下情已成追忆伤感出我的心声。

sentences.english: The noise gets in the way of your voice, so pare it down, trimming the noise from the bush until you’re left with truth.
sentences.chinese: 这种“噪音”混杂在你的心声中，所以必须把它摒除。

sentences.english: Such as sword, for the first time speak out.
sentences.chinese: 兰如剑第一次吐露心声。

sentences.english: Only those poems that reflect the scenes of an age and express the wishes of the masses can be called epics.
sentences.chinese: 反映时代风貌，表达人民心声的诗歌才能称为诗史。

sentences.english: Barriss hear the sound of the tile seto, two people can hear each others voice.
sentences.chinese: 芭丽听到瓦立阿的声音，两人都能听到对方的心声。

definition: (to express one's) true feelings/what is on one's mind/secret mind
words from the bottom of one's heart
to feel as if it had happened to oneself/to sympathize/(polite expression of gratitude for a favor received by a friend etc) I take it as a personal favor
to recount/to tell of/to relate/(fig.) (of a thing) to stand as testament to (some past history)
to say everything (that is on one's mind)
